description: See how Davidson compares to more than 2,000 American colleges.
title: Economic diversity and student outcomes at Davidson
title_page: Economic diversity and student outcomes at Davidson - The New York Times
text:
Davidson, North Carolina
The median family income of a student from Davidson is $213,900, and 70% come from the top 20 percent. Less than 1% of students at Davidson came from a poor family but became a rich adult.
A new study, based on millions of anonymous tax records, shows that some colleges are even more economically segregated than previously understood, while others are associated with income mobility.
Below, estimates of how Davidson compares with its peer schools in economic diversity and student outcomes.
